name: traitorously
content:

in a way that is not loyal to your own country, social group, beliefs, etc.: A small band of men had traitorously taken up arms against the government. It was hard to believe that anybody could act so traitorously against the interests of their country.
More examplesFewer examplesShe had stolen some confidential files and traitorously passed them on to a competitor.He traitorously sent a message to the Emperor that revealed the names of the conspirators.She traitorously left the opposition party to accept a job in the government.
